clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Patient Preferences Survey
clinical_study.official_title: COPD Patient Preferences, Activities, and Participation Survey

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to distribute a questionnaire created for individuals living with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) to assess their activities, participation, and healthcare and COPD-related research priorities. The data collected will be compared across diagnosed COPD stages and disease severity to determine the extent to which adults with COPD participate in the listed activities and identify their primary research and healthcare related priorities. The questionnaire was originally developed based on past research then verified by a panel of COPD and participation experts; as well as, individuals living with COPD in the form of focus groups. The questionnaire will now be administered to 200 individuals living COPD (50 in each GOLD stage) at three sites across Montreal where clinical data for each participant will be available. This phase will help establish the reliability of the questionnaire.

primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to distribute a percentage of time they would spend talking to their healthcare provider in the next year about various predefined healthcare topics. They can distribute percentages in increments of 10% for a total of 100%. The larger the percentage of time they allocate to a particular healthcare topic, the more important it is for them.

Participants will be asked to distribute a percentage of funding to various predefined research topics. They can distribute percentages in increments of 10% for a total of 100%. The larger the percentage of funding they allocate to a topic, the more important it is for them.
Participants will answer questions about their participation in 26 daily activities, as well as their desire to participate in each of the 26 daily activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume in 1-sec (FEV1) as assessed by spirometry
Self-reported intensity of physical activity related breathlessness as assessed by the modified Medical Research Council dyspnea scale (0-4)
Disease-specific health-related quality of life as assessed by the COPD Assessment Test

secondary_outcome.description: Will be combined with weight in kilograms to calculate Body Mass Index in kg/m^2
Will be combined with height in meters to calculate Body Mass Index in kg/m^2
Will be calculated with height in meters and weight in kilograms to calculate Body Mass Index in kg/m^2

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported physical activity levels as assessed by the Godin Leisure Time Physical Activity Questionnaire
Self-reported level of life satisfaction as assessed by the Satisfaction of Life Questionnaire
Number of exacerbations due to COPD in the preceding 12 months

intervention.description: Participants will answer an online survey and their medical chart information will be gathered to compare responses across disease severity.

study_pop.textblock: Adults living with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of COPD
- English or French speaking
- Patient at one of the three participating sites with medical chart
Exclusion Criteria:
- No diagnosis of COPD by a healthcare professional
- Unable to communicate in English or French
- Unable to provide informed consent
- No medical chart information at one of the three participating sites
